title: IWCA: Who are you voting for?
body:
Hey guys, Atlus here!

I want to know how you decided out your All-Star lineup!
http://i.imgur.com/rbtOHoa.png
Include an image of your picks and try to answer one or more of the following questions to give us an idea of your thought process!
(to add an image just paste the direct link into your post. Just upload a screenshot of your picks!)

* What changes did you have to make because of the only 2 per team rule?
* Did you think about the team as a whole and how the players would mesh or did you just pick your favorites?
* Did you look at the vocal members of the team? Too many shotcallers? Too few?
* Did you pick the players you like the most or the most skilled players?
* Did you base your choices off recent performance or career performance?

There is so much to consider and I can't wait to hear how you made your choices (Largely because I just can't seem to make up my own mind).

Drop a comment, let me know how you voted and let's see if we can win this thing! I can't wait to see your choices.

=D

replies.body: k1ng is the best player in the history of league of legends, its like the billionaire warren buffet says, the more times you vote for k1ng the more u earn or something I can't remember. #VOTEK1NG
Please, Raydere beats k1ng any day of the week.

While you may be right, I feel the skill discrepancy between Raydere and K1ng is a lot smaller than say Swip3rr and the other toplaners, and EGym and the other supports. It makes the team stronger and thats why EGym and Swip3rr as the 2 Chiefs got my votes.
K1ng is a phenomenal player. I think it comes down to what you value out of experience and knowledge vs. pure mechanical skill.

First pick was Swiffer (captain, shotcaller) in the mid lane, then Spookz in the jungle cos of the synergy. Minkywhale top cos hes the split pushing god. Cardrid ADC cos he's massively underrated, and NADA cos hes a good support (also underrated).

I like the 2 Chief decision, Swiffer and Spookz have been playing together for so long. I'm surprised by the Cardrid call, he has had some excellent games in the past though (looking back to Winter 2014 especially).
I read NADA's twitter post, he's always been solid in the bot lane but I don't know if Cardrid is the best fit for his almost foolhardy aggression.

> [{quoted}](name=Atlus,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=m2LoFHJp,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-09-29T04:07:46.305+0000)
>
> I like the 2 Chief decision, Swiffer and Spookz have been playing together for so long. I'm surprised by the Cardrid call, he has had some excellent games in the past though (looking back to Winter 2014 especially).
> I read NADA's twitter post, he's always been solid in the bot lane but I don't know if Cardrid is the best fit for his almost foolhardy aggression.

Hey buddy, fair comment. Enjoying worlds? :) Trust me, Cardrid is good. However it was always gonna happen that EGym and Raydere would get most the vote, eliminating any more Chiefs, which meant that Chuchuz and Carbon would get the vote eliminating any more Legacy, producing a lucky top laner :)

Personally my votes were more based off the second pick i'd want to see in there over the first.

I gathered Raydere, Egym and Carbon would be high picks, so i decided that i would leave those 3 even though they would have been my first picks but the 2 per team rule made me jump off them fairly quickly.

I wanted to see a Swip3rR top lane, and figured he'd probably be under picked due to the ruling (i actually thought that Raydere and Egym would be the main picks for Chiefs.)

Also picked me some Spookz as a back up for that carbon pick which i knew would be dominant.

I've always kinda liked ChuChuz mid laning so he was the mid laning pick.

And picked me some King and Nada in the bot lane.

So picking more to make up for less popular players... interesting. Not sure I get the goal from it.

There seems to be a few highly dominant picks in each Role, it'll be interesting to see which ones get through based on the no more than 2 per team rule.
It's more a matter of "I think X will recieve a lot of votes, but if they aren't getting enough votes because of the rules, i'd Have Y."
